page.title: 13OGMORE VALLEY RUGBY UNION
page.content: NANT-Y-MOEL R.F.C. STARTED IN 1885/86 SEASON. THEY USED TO HAVE TWO TEAMS, ONE WAS NANT-Y-MOEL SENIOR XV AND THE YOUTH SIDE WAS CALLED NANT-Y-MOEL WHITE STARS. THEY HAVE THEIR OWN GROUND, STAND AND CAR PARK. MANY YEARS AGO THE YOUTH SIDE DISBANDED. IT WAS RESTARTED AGAIN IN 1979 AND WAS CALLED NANT-Y-MOEL YOUTH. THIS YEAR IS NANT-Y-MOEL CENTENTARY, THE YOUTH SIDE IS GOING BACK TO THE NAME NANT-Y-MOEL WHITE STARS, FOR THIS REASON ONLY. NANT-Y-MOEL STARTED A FEW YEARS AFTER THEIR GREAT RIVALS OGMORE VALE. THERE IS GREAT RIVALRY BETWEEN THEM. THEY PLAY FOR THEIR CUP ANNUALLY DONATED BY THE FAMILY OF A MAN WHO DIED IN NORTHERN IRELAND. FOR THE FIRST FEW YEARS NANT-Y-MOEL WON THE CUP BUT MORE RECENTLY OGMORE VALE HAVE GAINED SUPERIORITY.
